titleStmt.title: Jeff Brown to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2256

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville 3rd Oct. 1865.
Hon. Thos E Bramlette;
Gov'r of Ky.
Dear Gov'r:

An old friend, J. W. Watcott, Esq. of Memphis Tenn, formerly of Cinti, desires me to recommend his name to you, as one in every way qualified to hold and exercise the duties of "Commissioner of Deeds for Ky;" and if you could upon my solicitation procure him the appointment I can say that you will find no worthier Gentleman, and no one who would make a better officer. I am in hope you will find it not disagreeable to appoint him.

Comr Deeds
Tennessee
J W. Westcott
comd
5 Oct 1865
